Key Match Events: Mohammad Amir picked up two wickets in his first two overs upon return
Others: Mohammad Amir had retired from international cricket in 2020, citing mental torture from the Pakistan Cricket Board
Amir overcame the setbacks and made his first comeback to international cricket in January 2016

His career had seemed full of possibilities in his early days, but slammed into a major hurdle in 2010 when he was implicated in a spot-fixing scandal, that led to a five-year ban from all forms of cricket and a brief jail term as well
Amir, then aged 28, announced his retirement from international cricket in December 2020, citing mental torture and dissatisfaction with the management as his reasons
Now, Amir 3.0 appears to have emerged, and is eager to give elite cricket another go
